alert.note: Alert for Warren (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 11 at 1:55PM CDT until May 11 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WARREN...RANKIN...WESTERN SIMPSON...CLAIBORNE... SOUTHWESTERN YAZOO...HINDS...COPIAH AND MADISON COUNTIES... At 155 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bentonia to near Pocahontas to Raymond to near Mcbride, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Jackson, Clinton, Raymond, Flora, Bentonia and Pocahontas around 200 PM CDT. Byram around 205 PM CDT. Ridgeland and Annandale around 210 PM CDT. Madison, Canton, Richland, Gluckstadt and Glancy around 215 PM CDT. Pearl, Flowood, Hazlehurst, Martinsville and Monterey around 220 PM CDT. Fannin around 225 PM CDT. Brandon and Goshen Springs around 230 PM CDT. Pisgah and Sharon around 235 PM CDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for southwestern and west central Mississippi. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central and south central Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
